main event: Two airmen observed a bright, round object with a brilliant pale blue light traveling at high speed over Keesler AFB in Mississippi on October 1, 1959.
interesting points: The object was about 60 feet in diameter and at an altitude of around 1,000 feet.
The object traveled at an estimated speed of 600-700 mph initially, then made an abrupt turn and accelerated to an estimated 3,000 mph.
The object made no sound and left no vapor trail.
The entire observation lasted about 2-3 minutes.
The observers included Capt. [redacted] and Lt. [redacted] who were on flying safety patrol at the time.
sighted object: a bright, round object with a brilliant pale blue light
